text: We say nothing essential about the cathedral when we speak of its stones. We say nothing essential about Man when we seek to define him by the qualities of men.
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

text: There is frequently more to be learned from the unexpected questions of a child than the discourses of men.
author: John Locke

text: Wine hath drowned more men than the sea.
author: Thomas Fuller

text: The worst thing about some men is that when they are not drunk they are sober.
author: William Butler Yeats

text: Some old men, continually praise the time of their youth. In fact, you would almost think that there were no fools in their days, but unluckily they themselves are left as an example.
author: Alexander Pope
